author: Vikas Pathak
text:
BJP chief Amit Shah met the core group members of BJP’s Uttar Pradesh and Gujarat units on Sunday to discuss organisational issues and election of State unit chiefs.

The presence of Gujarat Chief Minister Anandiben Patel, in the eye of a storm over allegations of irregularities in land allotment, at the meeting sparked speculation.

However, a party leader said a core group meeting was not the place to discuss such an issue.

A BJP leader said challenges in the State, where the party received a setback in the local body polls and faces the Patel agitation, were discussed at the meeting held late in the evening.

The meeting was preceded by another of the party’s U.P. core group earlier in the day. The Assembly polls early next year is believed to have been discussed at the meeting. Mr. Shah told party leaders to take the schemes of the Narendra Modi government to the people in the villages.

Sources said the message was to inform the people of the farm crop insurance and the Mudra Bank schemes for small entrepreneurs. The party is planning a large farmers’ rally at Bareilly on February 28, in a bid to reach out to them in this largely agrarian State.
title: Amit Shah meets leaders
